messages.message:
<!here> I'm going to be shoe-horning a chainguard-migrated version of `conversion-service` into `aihub-sandbox` so I can run system tests against it. The service builds and runs seemingly fine, but has evidently failed system tests in prior attempts.
*If you run into problems on `aihub-sandbox` before I announce that I've rolled back my change in this thread - be patient, it'll be rolled back when I'm done.*
Testing is done (failed), `aihub-sandbox` is currently undergoing its scheduled deployment so it'll be rolled to the proper image shortly

Hi, @Cody Boggs, aihub-sandbox deployment has not gone through since you rolled back the changes. It keeps on failing on install-ib-platform (https://jenkins.instabase.com/job/SAAS-AWS/job/saas-pipelines/job/install-ib-platform/21012/console).
It has broken the aihub-sandbox (https://aihub-sandbox.internal.instabase.com/) completely.
Cc: @Balaram <!subteam^S02FJA6A7U5>

I dont think what put aihub-sandbox into a bad state is related to the testing earlier today.

Testing was canarrying an image for conversion-service in aihub-sandbox and then running the PIAs to confirm it was working, but since it failed, the next deploy cleaned up the image change (which it did based on DM (https://aihub-sandbox.internal.instabase.com/deployment-manager/dashboard/deployments/apps/v1/conversion-service/deployment-conversion-service-7dbdbb74bd-gq2cd))

What caused the wider breakage was this deploy earlier today (https://jenkins.instabase.com/job/SAAS-AWS/job/deploy-saas-aws-preprod/33239/parameters/) where Elasticache was re-enabled. Based on the error I found in api-server `Error: secret "elasticache-auth-token" not found`, this led me to a thread (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CCY413CSU/p1736541977634429?thread_ts=1736498163.984299&cid=CCY413CSU) suggesting we need to delete the patch created to enable Elasticache. I will go ahead and delete that patch and hopefully things turn up properly again

cc @Anil
aihub-sandbox is back up and running. the current deploy might fail as it seems stuck in undo_turndown even though all deployments are now up and running. The next deploy should be successful.
